physical_appearance:The image shows a rectangular colour photograph.  There is an inner and outer border. The surrounding frame is dark brown in colour. A woman and an infant are present in the portrait. Both of them are looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. The woman holds the infant in her arms and lap. She is sitting on a chair with curved handles.

sgcool_label_text:This hand-coloured photograph shows a women with a baby on her lap. Inscribed on the photograph is the studio mark ‘The Eastern Studio Singapore’. \r\n\r\nEastern Studio was set up by the early 1920s by Lee King Yan

A woman and an infant are present in the portrait. Both of them are looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. The woman holds the infant in her arms and lap. metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This hand-coloured photograph shows a women with a baby on her lap. Inscribed on the photograph is the studio mark ‘The Eastern Studio Singapore’. 

Eastern Studio was set up by the early 1920s by Lee King Yan, who was also the founder of Lee Brothers Studio. A well-respected photographer in Singapore, newspapers lauded him as ‘one of the pioneers of photography’ in Singapore and the ‘Colony’s Grand Old Man of Photography’ at the time of his passing.
